member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2BitInputStream
member.summary: Implements a bit-wise input stream

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2BitInputStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Public constructor
member.param: The input stream to wrap

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2BitInputStream.ReadBoolean
member.summary: Reads a single bit from the wrapped input stream
member.return: true if the bit read was 1, otherwise false
member.exception: if no more bits are available in the input stream

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2BitInputStream.ReadUnary
member.summary: Reads a zero-terminated unary number from the wrapped input stream
member.exception: if no more bits are available in the input stream

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2BitInputStream.ReadBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads up to 32 bits from the wrapped input stream
member.param: The number of bits to read (maximum 32)
member.return: The bits requested, right-aligned within the integer
member.exception: if no more bits are available in the input stream

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2BitOutputStream
member.summary: Implements a bit-wise output stream
member.remarks: Allows the writing of single bit booleans, unary numbers, bit strings of arbitrary length(up to 24 bits), and bit aligned 32-bit integers.A single byte at a time is written to the wrapped stream when sufficient bits have been accumulated

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2BlockCompressor
member.summary: Compresses and writes a single BZip2 block
member.remarks: Block encoding consists of the following stages: 1. Run-Length Encoding[1] - write() 2. Burrows Wheeler Transform - close() (through BZip2DivSufSort) 3. Write block header - close() 4. Move To Front Transform - close() (through BZip2HuffmanStageEncoder) 5. Run-Length Encoding[2] - close() (through BZip2HuffmanStageEncoder) 6. Create and write Huffman tables - close() (through BZip2HuffmanStageEncoder) 7. Huffman encode and write data - close() (through BZip2HuffmanStageEncoder)

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2BlockDecompressor
member.summary: Reads and decompresses a single BZip2 block
member.remarks: Block decoding consists of the following stages: 1. Read block header - BZip2BlockDecompressor() 2. Read Huffman tables - readHuffmanTables() 3. Read and decode Huffman encoded data - decodeHuffmanData() 4. Run-Length Decoding[2] - decodeHuffmanData() 5. Inverse Move To Front Transform - decodeHuffmanData() 6. Inverse Burrows Wheeler Transform - initialiseInverseBWT() 7. Run-Length Decoding[1] - read() 8. Optional Block De-Randomisation - read() (through decodeNextBWTByte())

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2DivSufSort
member.summary: DivSufSort suffix array generator Based on libdivsufsort 1.2.3 patched to support BZip2
member.remarks: This is a simple conversion of the original C with two minor bugfixes applied(see "BUGFIX" comments within the class). Documentation within the class is largely absent.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2HuffmanStageDecoder
member.summary: A decoder for the BZip2 Huffman coding stage

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2HuffmanStageEncoder
member.summary: An encoder for the BZip2 Huffman encoding stage

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2MTFAndRLE2StageEncoder
member.summary: An encoder for the BZip2 Move To Front Transform and Run-Length Encoding[2] stages
member.remarks: An encoder for the BZip2 Move To Front Transform and Run-Length Encoding[2] stages. Although conceptually these two stages are separate, it is computationally efficient to perform them in one pass.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2InputStream
member.summary: An InputStream wrapper that decompresses BZip2 data
member.remarks: Instances of this class are not threadsafe

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2InputStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Public constructor
member.param: The InputStream to wrap
If true, the caller is assumed to have read away the stream's leading "BZ" identifier bytes

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2InputStream.InitialiseStream
member.summary: Reads the stream header and checks that the data appears to be a valid BZip2 stream
member.exception: if the stream header is not valid

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2InputStream.InitialiseNextBlock
member.summary: Prepares a new block for decompression if any remain in the stream
member.remarks: If a previous block has completed, its CRC is checked and merged into the stream CRC. If the previous block was the final block in the stream, the stream CRC is validated
member.return: true if a block was successfully initialised, or false if the end of file marker was encountered
member.exception: If either the block or stream CRC check failed, if the following data is not a valid block-header or end-of-file marker, or if the following block could not be decoded

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2OutputStream
member.summary: An OutputStream wrapper that compresses BZip2 data
member.remarks: Instances of this class are not threadsafe

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2OutputStream.STREAM_START_MARKER_1
member.summary: The first 2 bytes of a Bzip2 marker

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2OutputStream.STREAM_START_MARKER_2
member.summary: The 'h' that distinguishes BZip from BZip2

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2OutputStream.STREAM_END_MARKER_1
member.summary: First three bytes of the end of stream marker

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2OutputStream.STREAM_END_MARKER_2
member.summary: Last three bytes of the end of stream marker

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2OutputStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Public constructor
member.param: The output stream to write to
The BZip2 block size as a multiple of 100,000 bytes (minimum 1, maximum 9)
True if the underlying stream will be closed with the current Stream
member.exception: On any I/O error writing to the output stream
member.remarks: Larger block sizes require more memory for both compression and decompression, but give better compression ratios. 9 will usually be the best value to use

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2OutputStream.InitialiseNextBlock
member.summary: Initialises a new block for compression

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2OutputStream.CloseBlock
member.summary: Compress and write out the block currently in progress
member.remarks: If no bytes have been written to the block, it is discarded
member.exception: On any I/O error writing to the output stream

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.BZip2OutputStream.Finish
member.summary: Compresses and writes out any as yet unwritten data, then writes the end of the BZip2 stream
member.remarks: The underlying OutputStream is not closed
member.exception: On any I/O error writing to the output stream

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.Math.HuffmanAllocator
member.summary: An in-place, length restricted Canonical Huffman code length allocator
member.remarks: Based on the algorithm proposed by R.L.Milidiú, A.A.Pessoa and E.S.Laber in "In-place Length-Restricted Prefix Coding" (see: http://www-di.inf.puc-rio.br/~laber/public/spire98.ps) and incorporating additional ideas from the implementation of "shcodec" by Simakov Alexander (see: http://webcenter.ru/~xander/)

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.Bzip2.Math.HuffmanAllocator.AllocateHuffmanCodeLengths(System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocates Canonical Huffman code lengths in place based on a sorted frequency array
member.param: On input, a sorted array of symbol frequencies; On output, an array of Canonical Huffman code lenghts
The maximum code length. Must be at least ceil(log2(array.length))

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Data.IO.MSWindows
member.summary:
# Windows Data Types
> https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/desktop/WinProg/windows-data-types
The data types supported by Windows are used to define function return values, function and message parameters, and structure members. They define the size and meaning of these elements. For more information about the underlying C/C++ data types, see Data Type Ranges.
The following table contains the following types: character, Integer, Boolean, pointer, And handle.The character, Integer, And Boolean types are common to most C compilers. Most of the pointer-type names begin with a prefix of P Or LP. Handles refer to a resource that has been loaded into memory.
